crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
The CRNRSTN Suite :: has hooks for an encryption layer baked into the fabric of it's session management policy. When initsessionencryption() is called, a layer of encryption is initialized for the specified $envKey. If you don't want the performance hit that comes with adding a layer of encryption to the session management policy and desire to turn it off, simply comment out or delete this method call in your CRNRSTN configuration file, and all string and integer session data will be handled in clear text.
It should be noted that there are some combinations of openssl_get_cipher_methods()[$opensslEncryptCipher] and hash_algos()[$hmacAlg] algorithms that will not be compatible together due to the way that the CRNRSTN Suite encrypts/decrypts your data. If using session encryption, please quietly test the CRNRSTN Suite configuration for all environments...especially before rolling out to your production application.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: A user-defined custom string identifying a specific hosting environment or server profile. E.g. "LOCALHOST_MY_OLD_MAC_TOWER", "LOCALHOST_PC" or "PROD_01".
For a list of recommended and available openssl cipher methods...run $oCRNRSTN_ENV->openssl_get_cipher_methods()
Specify an encryption key to be used by the CRNRSTN encryption layer for encryptable session data.
A bitwise disjunction of the flags OPENSSL_RAW_DATA and OPENSSL_ZERO_PADDING.

Specify the algorithm to be used by CRNRSTN when using the HMAC library to generate a keyed hash value. For a list of available algorithms run hash_algos(). CAUTION :: Some hash_algos returned algorithms will NOT be compatible with hash_hmac() which CRNRSTN uses in validating it's decryption. And certain openssl encryption cipher / hash_algos algorithm combinations will not be compatible. Please test the initSessionEncryption() compatibility of your desired encryption cipher and hmac algoritm in each environment...especially before releasing to production code base.
